summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Death Row - A History of Capital Punishment in America - A 6-Part Documentary Series
Review Date: 2016/11/08
Store: Various  (Actor, Director)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Documentary
Product Description: ['This hard-hitting 6-part documentary series on 2 discs, featuring interviews from experts in the field as well as archival footage, examines America\'s history with the death penalty: it\'s roots in frontier justice, the technologies that changed nooses and firing squads to electric chairs and lethal injections, the legal battles defining exactly what is "cruel and unusual punishment", the ceremonial aspect of requested "last meals", and some of the most notorious killers who met it as a final end']
Average Rating: 3.9
Product Details: {'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 5.12 Ounces', 'Director': 'Various', 'Media Format': 'NTSC', 'Run time': '5 hours and 34 minutes', 'Release date': 'February 2, 2016', 'Actors': 'Various', 'Studio': 'Centre Communication', 'Number of discs': '2'}
Review Text: Can be very informative. Some points should've been more in depth, but overall it is an informative and entertaining documentary if you are interested in the history of the subject.
Review Title: Informative
Rating: 4.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: The Stanford Prison Experiment [Blu-ray]
Review Date: 2016/11/08
Store: Billy Crudup  (Actor),     Ezra Miller  (Actor),     Kyle Patrick Alvarez  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: Blu-ray
Categories: Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies
Product Description: ['What happens when a college psych study goes shockingly wrong? Based on the notorious true story, THE STANFORD PRISON EXPERIMENT stars Billy Crudup (Watchmen) as Stanford University professor Dr. Philip Zimbardo, who, in 1971, cast 24 student volunteers as prisoners and guards in a simulated jail to examine the source of abusive behavior in the prison system. The results astonished the world, as participants went from middle-class undergrads to drunk-with-power sadists and submissive victims in just a few days. Featuring an extraordinary cast including Ezra Miller, Olivia Thirlby, Tye Sheridan, Keir Gilchrist, Michael Angarano, and Thomas Mann, and created with the close participation of Dr. Zimbardo himself, THE STANFORD PRISON EXPERIMENT is a chilling, edge-of-your-seat thriller about the dark side of power and the effects of imprisonment.']
Average Rating: 4.4
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Action & Adventure/Thrillers', 'Format': 'Blu-ray, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Ezra Miller, Moises Arias, Billy Crudup, Gaius Charles, Kyle Patrick Alvarez, Tye Sheridan', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 2 minutes', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '35224399', 'Director': 'Kyle Patrick Alvarez', 'Media Format': 'Blu-ray, Widescreen', 'Run time': '2 hours and 2 minutes', 'Release date': 'January 12, 2016', 'Actors': 'Billy Crudup, Ezra Miller, Tye Sheridan, Gaius Charles, Moises Arias', 'Studio': 'IFC Independent Film', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: Interesting concept and film, but feels at points like it's dragging or was extended to make a certain time or length for the film. Acting is very good and keeps the viewer's attention even as the film hits some points that would otherwise lose the viewer's attention.
Review Title: Interesting
Rating: 3.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2016/12/15
Average Rating: 3.5
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: Low', 'English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Liza Johnson'], 'Producers': ['Holly Wiersma', 'Cassian Elwes', 'Cary Elwes'], 'Starring': ['Michael Shannon', 'Kevin Spacey', 'Alex Pettyfer'], 'Studio': ['Amazon Studios']}
Review Text: Kevin Spacey does a really good job of being Nixon.  Michael Shannon does a good job of playing Elvis once you're able to get over the fact that he doesn't look too much like him. It took me a little while to get over that at the beginning of the movie, but once I did I enjoyed the movie. It is an intriguing subject for a movie, and the idea of what could or may have happened keeps you interested. Overall it is an entertaining movie.
Review Title: Kevin Spacey does a really good job of being Nixon
Rating: 3.0
--------------------------------------------------

Review Date: 2017/01/27

Product Description: ['In this heart-pounding, edge-of-your-seat thriller, veteran 911 operator Jordan (Academy Award® Winner Halle Berry, Monster’s Ball, 2001) takes a life-altering call from a teenage girl (Academy Award® nominee Abigail Breslin, Little Miss Sunshine, 2006) who has been kidnapped and thrown into the trunk of a madman’s car. But with the clock ticking, Jordan soon realizes she must confront a killer from her past to put an end to a serial killer’s haunting rampage. Also starring Morris Chestnut.']

=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: The Walk (3D Blu-ray + Blu-ray)
Review Date: 2017/01/27
Store: Joseph Gordon-Levitt  (Actor),     Ben Kingsley  (Actor),     Robert Zemeckis  (Director, Producer)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: Blu-ray
Categories: Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies
Product Description: ['Twelve people have walked on the moon, but only one man – Philippe Petit (Joseph Gordon-Levitt) – has ever walked in the immense void between the World Trade Center towers. Guided by his real-life mentor, Papa Rudy (Ben Kingsley), and aided by an unlikely band of international recruits, Petit and his gang overcome long odds, betrayals, dissension, and countless close calls to conceive and execute their mad plan. Academy Award-winning director Robert Zemeckis uses advanced technology in the service of an emotional, character-driven story. THE WALK is a love letter to Paris and New York City in the 1970s, but most of all, to the Towers of the World Trade Center.']
Average Rating: 4.6

Categories: Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies
Product Description: ['What happens when a college psych study goes shockingly wrong? Based on the notorious true story, THE STANFORD PRISON EXPERIMENT stars Billy Crudup (Watchmen) as Stanford University professor Dr. Philip Zimbardo, who, in 1971, cast 24 student volunteers as prisoners and guards in a simulated jail to examine the source of abusive behavior in the prison system. The results astonished the world, as participants went from middle-class undergrads to drunk-with-power sadists and submissive victims in just a few days. Featuring an extraordinary cast including Ezra Miller, Olivia Thirlby, Tye Sheridan, Keir Gilchrist, Michael Angarano, and Thomas Mann, and created with the close participation of Dr. Zimbardo himself, THE STANFORD PRISON EXPERIMENT is a chilling, edge-of-your-seat thriller about the dark side of power and the effects of imprisonment.']
Average Rating: 4.4

Review Text: Kevin Spacey does a really good job of being Nixon.  Michael Shannon does a good job of playing Elvis once you're able to get over the fact that he doesn't look too much like him. It took me a little while to get over that at the beginning of the movie, but once I did I enjoyed the movie. It is an intriguing subject for a movie, and the idea of what could or may have happened keeps you interested. Overall it is an entertaining movie.

Review Text: I really liked the cast and the idea, but felt like the way the movie was contained into a few rooms throughout the whole movie hurt the overall experience. Some movies can benefit from this effect of claustrophobia or limited environment, but I feel like this one didn't, and the cast is what kept it afloat.

Product Description: ['Twelve people have walked on the moon, but only one man – Philippe Petit (Joseph Gordon-Levitt) – has ever walked in the immense void between the World Trade Center towers. Guided by his real-life mentor, Papa Rudy (Ben Kingsley), and aided by an unlikely band of international recruits, Petit and his gang overcome long odds, betrayals, dissension, and countless close calls to conceive and execute their mad plan. Academy Award-winning director Robert Zemeckis uses advanced technology in the service of an emotional, character-driven story. THE WALK is a love letter to Paris and New York City in the 1970s, but most of all, to the Towers of the World Trade Center.']

SUMMARY:
The individual demonstrates a strong preference for documentary and thriller genres, particularly those that delve into psychological and societal themes. Consistent ratings around the mid to high range (3.0 to 5.0) indicate a discerning taste, with a tendency to appreciate films that offer depth, historical context, or provocative narratives, as seen in their engagement with true crime and psychological experiments. Repeated emphasis on film quality and engaging storytelling suggests a preference for well-crafted productions, although they occasionally note pacing issues.

Quality appears pivotal, as evidenced by high ratings for well-regarded series or films, while moderate ratings signal disappointment in aspects like length or depth. Price sensitivity is not explicitly indicated; however, the diverse formats ranging from DVD to Blu-ray suggest a willingness to invest in experiences deemed worthwhile. The analysis further reveals a pattern of enjoying ensemble cast productions, demonstrating an interest in strong performances as a key factor for viewer satisfaction. Overall, the shopping behavior points towards an appreciation for thought-provoking content, strong production quality, and compelling character portrayals, with a gradual inclination towards thrillers and narratives tackling complex human experiences.

target_interaction.title: Great set
target_interaction.text: Great set with plenty of extras to revisit this classic.
description: Relive the adventure and magic in one of the most beloved motion pictures of all-time, E.T. The Extra-Terrestrial, from Academy Award-winning director Steven Spielberg. Captivating audiences of all ages, this timeless story follows the unforgettable journey of a lost alien and the 10-year-old boy he befriends. Join Elliot (Henry Thomas), Gertie (Drew Barrymore) and Michael (Robert MacNaughton) as they come together to help E.T. find his way back home, E.T. The Extra-Terrestrial is "one of the great American films" (Leonard Maltin) that forever belongs in the hearts and minds of audiences everywhere.

Your Digital Copy redemption code is printed on an insert inside your Blu-ray/DVD package.A Digital Copy is a digital version of the full-length movie that you get when you own specially-marked Blu-ray/DVD discs bearing the “Digital” logo. Owning the digital version of the movie extends your enjoyment because it enables you to download or stream your movie to a computer, mobile device, internet-connected TV, Blu-ray player, or set-top box.
